DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Disease or Disorder Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The condition or state of disease with regards to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Not responding to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.9 Added Alt VM per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

PermissibleValues.value: Relapse with greater than or equal to 5% blasts
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrent Disease With Greater Than or Equal To Five Percent Unit Blast Cell

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrent Disease With Greater Than or Equal To Five Percent Unit Blast Cell
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: An immature blood cell.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
A precursor cell which gives rise to a fully differentiated cell of hematopoietic lineage.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recurrent Disease With Less Than Five Percent Unit Blast Cell Minimal Residual Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recurrent Disease With Less Than Five Percent Unit Blast Cell Minimal Residual Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: An immature blood cell.: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
A precursor cell which gives rise to a fully differentiated cell of hematopoietic lineage.
Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.
A disease that resists treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
